title: It's not Aktuelle... Is this Opti Sport, Spoleto, or something else?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721013800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/straight-dry_5509.jpg)
  
.  
I know this has been asked a million times... but let's try again.  
.  
I want to acquire a version of this font that is as clean as this example. I have Aktuelle, but it is not clean like this.  
.  
How about Opti Sport or Spoleto? Are either of those as clean as this example?
author: dirtcastle

comments.content:
As far as I know they’re all the same.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721013800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Spoleto_5454.gif)
  
(Image from [Mike Yanega’s site](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721013800/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg14.html))

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721013800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/aktuelle_example_5807.jpg)
  
.  
The above example is from Aktuelle, and I think there are some clear differences in the quality, when compared to the example in my first post.

Or maybe I'm just trippin. But to me, this Aktuelle looks like a scan of a scan of a live trace of a scan of a xerox copy of a... well, you get the idea.
You could consider [Fenway Park](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721013800/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/fenway+park/fonts/) as a better quality alternative.

Fenway Park is definitely higher quality vector work.

That said... I must admit to being very particular about the style I want. For my taste, Fenway Park has too many parallel lines and a bit much contrast. And many of the caps don't work for me.

Maybe it's time to get busy in FontLab.

Bojev!

I feel like we are characters on a show called **TCSI: The Web Files** (Typographic Crime Scene Investigators).  
.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721013800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SportComp_5867_overlay_5782.jpg)

They are pretty close, actually. It looks like Aktuelle is a slightly modified and narrowed version of Opti Sport.

And so this raises the question of whether Opti Sport would also leave me disappointed.

Well, for the third alternative, I actually have Spoleto, the version by Novel Fonts that was used for the sample that Jan posted. I don't know that I can re-create the forensic view done by Bob. If you have limited typesetting you need, I would be glad to set some for you as a courtesy. E-mail me what you need at bowfinboy (at) seanet (dot) com.

- Mike Yanega

Here's an attempt to use Spoleto to approximate the original sample, without the leaves.

- Mike Yanega
